title: Time-stamped history
content:
Archived 2020 query at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1360922#answer-1465978 asked for time-stamped history list. Instructions in the response say after CMD(on Mac)/Shift/H you will see names of columns above the list. This does not appear - possibly deleted since the answer.

I'm trying to argue with a bank that I made a payment in business hours, and a time stamp on my history record would bolster my argument.

Is the list of columns mentioned available somehow? Can a date/time stamp be added to every history record? (Date is known, but not shown as a date stamp.) Is this info in there, but hidden, and available somehow?
creator: dick.harris

title: Sync reverting Bookmarks on linked computers to old setup after installing on new computer.

title: "Private window" as a separate browser
content: I have two PCs, both running the same versions of Firefox for years. A little over a year ago, after an update, a new "Private" icon appeared in my taskbar in addition to the normal Firefox icon on one of my machines, but not the other one. This presented, and functioned as two different, independent browser applications; I could just click on the private browser icon to open the private browser without opening the "regular" Firefox. I don't know where this came from, but I like it... but it never changed on my other PC, and I can't find how to apply it; is there a setting or something I'm missing? Why did it happen automatically on one machine, but not the other?

title: Unrecognized password
content:
Hello everyone, I am pretty sure to know my Mozilla account password. However, Mozilla keeps telling me I am writing it wrong. The only problem is that resetting the password implies that I "may lose some personal details", most notably my bookmarks...

Is someone able either to help me with the password problem or to tell me something more about password reset implications? For instance, am I actually going to lose some personal details? Or it is more some kind of precautionary ad, similar to the ones Android gives you when you are updating the OS on your phone?

Thank you,

title: Cache settings in Windows 11
content: Dear Support, I use Firefox to access Binance trading platform. On it, with the trading view tools, I draw the charts to get an idea where the price is and might go next. I need that the drawing is saved so I can contnue from where I left when I go to that asset again. When I used Windows 10, all the charts were nicely saved and stayed saved for months. Even when I logged in the platform away from home. No, when I switched to a new laptop with Windows 11, the chart drawings are not being saved reliably, sometimes the drawinmgs stay saved, sometimes not. Support people on that trading exchange, and on other platforms, connects the saving of the drawings to cache files on the laptop, but does not offer precise direction how to solve the issue. I am looking for some advice to find the solution? Is it not saved because of Windows 11? Is it not saved because of the use of a different laptop on the same IP? (Pls note, that I knew that I will have to redo the drawings on the charts with the laptop.) Is it because of the setting of capacity of cache? Thank you for your guidance and help. Kind regards

title: Firefox slow after fresh install
content: I decided to migrate from chrome to firefox, sadly, my experience has been faced with random slow downs or partial loads even on a fresh install. It's weird but it seems that at random times some websites will refuse to fully load or even start loading, it appears that the app is just hanging. This is usually fixed after several refreshes. Oddly enough, even on a fresh install, if I attempt to load up the same website while in private browsing, it loads right away, again this is consistent even on a fresh install, the attached image was an attempt to load youtube after signing in on a fresh install without add-ons, I tried loading up youtube in private and it worked right away. Chrome wasn't presenting this problem on my computer for years. Any ideas? My computer specs are high enough where they shouldn't matter. I'm running an AMD GPU (7900 XTX) but I haven't found any know issues regarding these, to even discard that, I disabled hardware acceleration, but the issue persisted. Running up to date windows 10, installing latest version of firefox.
creator: gabevt

title: YouTube Video Quality Limit
content: When I watch videos on Youtube, suddenly it says I can only watch them in 360p or 720p quality, when previously I had access to 4K and 8K video at maximum and 1080p average. Youtube says "YouTube videos are available in many formats and qualities. But, some browsers do not support newer video formats or quality options. This restriction means these browsers may only have one or two video formats to choose from. We recommend upgrading your browser or operating system for the best viewing experience." This has only happened now and it only happens with Firefox, as when watching videos with Safari 1080p video is available. I am using the latest version of Firefox on a Mac mini with the latest Mac OS installed.
creator: xenonaut10

title: Was unable to restore previous session
content: After a Windows system update, my usual first step has been to open Firefox and restore previous session. I am an old person and have had some memory difficulties in recent years so some of the pages I'd kept open on the taskbar icon had been there for as much as two or more years, but they always came back. After the most recent Windows update, the first thing that happened was that a message from McAfee (to which I subscribe) popped up. It was a very good 'Come-on," so I clicked it. It took me through doing some scans, then pitched a product that I didn't want to purchase so I closed that window. That resulted in a new, Firefox window opening, pitching the same product again. I now don't remember if I closed that pitch window and opened a new Firefox one before trying to restore previous session or if I tried the restore directly from that window but whichever I did, the only window that got restored was that latest McAfee pitch! Is there any way to get back the old stored Firefox pages from before the system update and my opening that McAfee window? Thank you very much.
